009package imagingbook.common.filter.examples;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilterSeparable;
015import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
016import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * Example filter based on {@link GenericFilterScalar} performing
022 * linear convolution with a custom 3x3 filter kernel.
023 * This filter may be applied to any image. 
024 * On vector-valued images (e.g., RGB images) the filter is applied
025 * independently to each component.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * Usage:
029 * </p>
030 * <pre>
031 * ImageProcessor ip = ...      // any image
032 * GenericFilter filter = new ExampleFilter3x3Scalar();
033 * filter.applyTo(ip);          // modifies ip
034 * </pre>
035 * <p>
036 * Note: This is merely a linear filter with a custom kernel to demonstrate
037 * the concept of a generic filter.
038 * In practice (depending on the type of kernel) this would be implemented
039 * as a sub-class of {@link LinearFilter} or {@link LinearFilterSeparable},
040 * which is much more efficient.
041 * </p>
042 * 
043 * @author WB
044 * @see LinearFilter
045 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
046 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)
047 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor, OutOfBoundsStrategy)
048 */
049public class ExampleFilter3x3Scalar extends GenericFilterScalar {
050
051        // custom (nonsymmetric) convolution kernel
052        private final static float[][] H = {
053                        {0, 1, 2},
054                        {7, 8, 3},
055                        {6, 5, 4}};
056        
057        private final static int width = H[0].length;                   // = 3
058        private final static int height = H.length;                             // = 3
059        private final static int xc = width / 2;                                // = 1
060        private final static int yc = height / 2;                               // = 1
061        private final static float s = (float) Matrix.sum(H);
062        
063        @Override
064        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice slice, int u, int v) {       // return scalar value
065                float sum = 0;
066                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
067                        int vj = v + j - yc;
068                        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
069                                int ui = u + i - xc;
070                                float p = slice.getVal(ui, vj);         // read scalar pixel value
071                                sum = sum + p * H[i][j];
072                        }
073                }
074                return sum / s;
075        }
076
077}
